Was misquoted - had Turkish hat campaign against him
Freelance writer Asli ErdoÄŸan - portrayed in Aftenbladet's large freebie project "Forbidden Voices" - has received a veritable hate campaign against him in Turkey after being mistaken in a Belgian newspaper.
07 Nov 2019, 13:03 by Jan Zahl
Once again, the award-winning Turkish author Asli ErdoÄŸan is in trouble. After the failed military coup in 2016 - which he was not involved in - he remained in prison for four months in Turkey. Today she lives in Frankfurt - where Aftenbladet met her in February, as one of six freelance writers in the Prohibited Voices project.
After giving an interview to the Italian newspaper La Repubblica on October 15, she is at the center of a massive hate campaign in Turkey.
In a letter to international supporters - among others Helge Lunde in Stavanger, who is director of the international freeware network Icorn - ErdoÄŸan asks for support and assistance after a nationwide lynching campaign has been launched against her. She points out that almost all newspapers, right-wing party campers and millionaires of social media users in Turkey have shared the campaign, which has gone beyond both Erdogan and her 75-year-old mother, who are still living in Istanbul.
- All this happens because of two sentences I have never said, write Erdogan.


Aftenbladet met Asli ErdoÄŸan in her exilby Frankfurt in February. She also attended a book fair in Frankfurt in October.ğŸ“· Finn VÃ¥ga

Fatal error citation
So the starting point for the whole is an interview ErdoÄŸan gave to an Italian journalist. La Repubblica reprinted the interview, in which ErdoÄŸan was quoted, among others, as saying that "Turkish children go through nationalist and military indoctrination entirely from childhood." She also said that "all parties in parliament, except HDP, tend to label all Kurdish organizations as" terrorists ". The title of the article remained in La Repubblica "Me is indoctrinated to see the Kurds as enemies" - although this was not a direct quote from ErdoÄŸan.
Eight days later, the Belgian newspaper Le Soir printed the interview, translated into French. ErdoÄŸan was not informed of this. But in Le Soir's version, Erdogan was now quoted as saying that "Me learns to hate Kurds from early childhood" and that "all political forces in parliament are terrorists except HDP."
The French, erroneous turnover was then picked up by the English-speaking Russian media agency Sputnik, which then spread the interview further. And so the false quotes in Turkish newspapers and media channels - to massive reactions.
Cause and support campaign
Le Soir went out this week with an official reason for Erdogan on Tuesday:
- Me has corrected these mistakes and published the correct version of the interview. Le Soir asks Asli ErdoÄŸan for cause, it is called by Le Soir.
Both the German and the Swedish branches of the freedom of speech organization PEN have been involved in the case.
- The hate storm against Asli ErdoÄŸan must be taken with utmost seriousness and terminated immediately. It is also important that one finds out why Le Soir newspaper and the media agency Sputnik have disseminated disinformation of this kind, writes Swedish PEN.
